intro: Restio confertospicatus, commonly known as the dense spike restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which is characterized by grass-like plants adapted to fire-prone environments. The plant typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained sandy or rocky soils. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small white or pale blue flowers. Restio confertospicatus plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various invertebrates and birds.
